column4: I see all of my mounts in nautilus under places and on my desktop..
JUst checking as I had not heard of that program
it's the fastest way to backup a DVD. OTOH, it's the most "stupid", and worse, since my Ubuntu install it stopped working.
YOu are not by chance using a fat32 to store the temp or anything are you
mplayer -dumpstream is the next on the scale. Slightly more clever about what it's doing, but potentially a bit slower ;(
I use k9copy and I am in no rush ...
Nope, the files are written into a directory that already stores >2GB files.
The question is always how it deals with the "defective" DVDs that are popular now.
copy protection will always be an issue
ogle can play most DVDs, but offers no option to capture the mpeg PS :(
The only DVD player that knows about navigation and that does that I know about is VLC, ...
Well, VLC is good but 1x slow.
use what works and speed will follow
